meanings.sent1: The sunrise antedated the chirping of the birds.
meanings.sent2: The history lesson explained how the ancient civilization antedated modern society.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock antedated my usual wake-up time, causing me to oversleep.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom antedated her years, making her seem older than she was.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of the fossil antedated any previous findings, changing our understanding of history.

meanings.definition: To assign a date earlier than the actual one.
meanings.sent1: The historian mistakenly antedated the manuscript by a century.
meanings.sent2: The antique dealer antedated the painting to the 18th century.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to antedate his homework submission to avoid a late penalty.
meanings.sent4: The forger antedated the signature on the document to make it appear authentic.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully antedated the artifacts to accurately place them in history.

meanings.definition: To come before in order or position.
meanings.sent1: The appetizers antedated the main course at the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The introduction of the new product antedated the competitor's similar release.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain antedated our picnic, forcing us to find shelter.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a skilled craftsman antedated his arrival in the village.
meanings.sent5: The early settlers antedated the establishment of the town, paving the way for its growth.
